item.title: To extend the Generalized System of Preferences, and for other purposes.
United States-Colombia Trade Promotion Agreement Implementation Act
United States-Panama Trade Promotion Agreement Implementation Act
United States-Korea Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act
Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2832) to extend the Generalized System of Preferences, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 425, H. Res. 418 is laid on the table.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 281 - 128 (Roll no. 771). (text: CR H6710)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 281 - 128 (Roll no. 771).(text: CR H6710)
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H6721)
Supplemental report filed by the Committee on Rules, H. Rept. 112-240, Part II.
Supplemental report filed by the Committee on Rules, H. Rept. 112-240, Part II.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 425.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H6710-6722)
Mr Dreier asked unanimous consent that the Committee on Rules be permitted to file a supplemental report to accompany H.Res. 425.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 79.

The bills shall be considered as read and debatable for the time specfied in the report. Pursuant to section 151 of the Trade Act of 1974, the previous question shall be considered as ordered on H.R. 3079 and H.R. 3080 to final passage without intervening motion. The resolution provides one motion to recommit for H.R. 3078. The resolution makes in order a motion that the House concur in the Senate amendment to H.R. 2832. The Senate amendment shall be considered as read. The resolution provides for one hour of debate on the motion to concur.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-240, by Mr. Dreier.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-240, by Mr. Dreier.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2832) to extend the Generalized System of Preferences, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3078) to implement the United States-Colombia Trade Promotion Agreement; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3079) to implement the United States-Panama Trade Promotion Agreement; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3080) to implement the United States-Korea Free Trade Agreement.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 2832) to extend the Generalized System of Preferences, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3078) to implement the United States-Colombia Trade Promotion Agreement; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3079) to implement the United States-Panama Trade Promotion Agreement; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3080) to implement the United States-Korea Free Trade Agreement.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
